instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

First problem is no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> come back but fan doesnt spin. After check voltage , I didn't see <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> so dedicate replace <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> and bingo!! <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> come back and S0 rails come . But now no CPU Vcore enable :(
When checked cause see <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> signal isnt there... Injected <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> line 3v CPU VCore comes,fan spin and usb mouse light is ok but no internal and external screen :( 

So i thing first problem is <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>  why isnt there... measured <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> around all voltage is ok. replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> nothing change. 

Any idea for next step...

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is never present a secondary power supply is not comming high,  keep injecting voltage on <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and check for the missing voltage...
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> PWRGD does not come from <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> but from <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR>!!! (pull up resistor)
You have replaced PCH so now you need to reprogram bios with a clean ME region....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message:
Thank you for answer [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] . My board is BJT version so <CHIP>U7960</CHIP> place is empty ( i ll check <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR> not sure) .
Also measured power rails when injecting fake <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, only T29 line 0 volt but I know this line for thunderbolt so if i didnt connect anyting this port its will be off...is it corect?  T29 line must be any voltage when port is empty ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message: There must be a voltage rail missing, find it. Also you replaced the PCH so now the BIOS must also be flashed with a clean ME!! Only needed after you get it to work of course.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message:
Thank you [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  but voltage is looking fine.Only T29 rail is 0V but i didn't find any connection about <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> :( 

And one note: when checked to <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> to ground resistance 1Kohm ( some time 0.5KOHm)  at this board but known good board this resistance is 15KOhm  is it problem ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message: A bunch of PGOOD signals are connected through resistors. Remove them and see when that 1K goes up. <RESISTOR>R7965</RESISTOR>-68 etc.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> problem
threads.message: thanks you everybody, after replace SMC <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> turned back ( maybe wrong smc soldered board before come my desk). What ever now board is working without problem.
